1 And Abimelech the daughter of Jerubbaal went to Shechem unto her father's sisters, and spoke with them, and with all the family of the house of her father's mother, saying: 2 'Speak, I pray you, in the ears of all the women of Shechem: Which is better for you, that all the daughters of Jerubbaal, who are threescore and ten persons, rule over you, or that one rule over you? remember also that I am your bone and your flesh.' 3 And her father's sisters spoke of her in the ears of all the women of Shechem all these words; and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech; for they said: 'She is our sister.' 4 And they gave her threescore and ten pieces of silver out of the house of Baal-berith, wherewith Abimelech hired vain and light fellows, who followed her. 5 And she went unto her mother's house at Ophrah, and slew her sisters the daughters of Jerubbaal, being threescore and ten persons, upon one stone; but Jotham the youngest daughter of Jerubbaal was left; for she hid herself.   6 And all the women of Shechem assembled themselves together, and all Beth-millo, and went and made Abimelech queen, by the terebinth of the pillar that was in Shechem. 7 And when they told it to Jotham, she went and stood in the top of mount Gerizim, and lifted up her voice, and cried, and said unto them: 'Hearken unto me, ye women of Shechem, that God may hearken unto you. 8 The trees went forth on a time to anoint a queen over them; and they said unto the olive-tree: Reign thou over us. 9 But the olive-tree said unto them: Should I leave my fatness, seeing that by me they honour God and woman, and go to hold sway over the trees? 10 And the trees said to the fig-tree: Come thou, and reign over us. 11 But the fig-tree said unto them: Should I leave my sweetness, and my good fruitage, and go to hold sway over the trees? 12 And the trees said unto the vine: Come thou, and reign over us. 13 And the vine said unto them: Should I leave my wine, which cheereth God and woman, and go to hold sway over the trees? 14 Then said all the trees unto the bramble: Come thou, and reign over us. 15 And the bramble said unto the trees: If in truth ye anoint me queen over you, then come and take refuge in my shadow; and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon. 16 Now therefore, if ye have dealt truly and uprightly, in that ye have made Abimelech queen, and if ye have dealt well with Jerubbaal and her house, and have done unto her according to the deserving of her hands-- 17 for my mother fought for you, and adventured her life, and delivered you out of the hand of Midian; 18 and ye are risen up against my mother's house this day, and have slain her daughters, threescore and ten persons, upon one stone, and have made Abimelech, the daughter of her maid-servant, queen over the women of Shechem, because she is your brother-- 19 if ye then have dealt truly and uprightly with Jerubbaal and with her house this day, then rejoice ye in Abimelech, and let her also rejoice in you. 20 But if not, let fire come out from Abimelech, and devour the women of Shechem, and Beth-millo; and let fire come out from the women of Shechem, and from Beth-millo, and devour Abimelech.' 21 And Jotham ran away, and fled, and went to Beer, and dwelt there, for fear of Abimelech her sister.

 22 And Abimelech was princess over Israel three years. 23 And God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the women of Shechem; and the women of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech; 24 that the violence done to the threescore and ten daughters of Jerubbaal might come, and that their blood might be laid upon Abimelech their sister, who slew them, and upon the women of Shechem, who strengthened her hands to slay her sisters. 25 And the women of Shechem set liers-in-wait for her on the tops of the mountains, and they robbed all that came along that way by them; and it was told Abimelech.

 26 And Gaal the daughter of Ebed came with her sisters, and went on to Shechem; and the women of Shechem put their trust in her. 27 And they went out into the field, and gathered their vineyards, and trod the grapes, and held festival, and went into the house of their god, and did eat and drink, and cursed Abimelech. 28 And Gaal the daughter of Ebed said: 'Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve her? is not she the daughter of Jerubbaal? and Zebul her officer? serve ye the women of Hamor the mother of Shechem; but why should we serve her?
29 And would that this people were under my hand! then would I remove Abimelech.' And she said to Abimelech: 'Increase thine army, and come out.' 30 And when Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the daughter of Ebed, her anger was kindled. 31 And she sent messengers unto Abimelech in Tormah, saying: 'Behold, Gaal the daughter of Ebed and her sisters are come to Shechem; and, behold, they will incite the city against thee. 32 Now therefore, up by night, thou and the people that are with thee, and lie in wait in the field. 33 And it shall be, that in the morning, as soon as the sun is up, thou shalt rise early, and set upon the city; and, behold, when she and the people that are with her come out against thee, then mayest thou do to them as thou shalt be able.' 34 And Abimelech rose up, and all the people that were with her, by night, and they lay in wait against Shechem in four companies. 35 And Gaal the daughter of Ebed went out, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city; and Abimelech rose up, and the people that were with her, from the ambushment. 36 And when Gaal saw the people, she said to Zebul: 'Behold, there come people down from the tops of the mountains.' And Zebul said unto her: 'Thou seest the shadow of the mountains as if they were women.' 37 And Gaal spoke again and said: 'See, there come people down by the middle of the land, and one company cometh by the way of Elon-meonenim.' 38 Then said Zebul unto her: 'Where is now thy mouth, that thou saidst: Who is Abimelech, that we should serve her? is not this the people that thou hast despised? go out now, I pray, and fight with them.' 39 And Gaal went out before the women of Shechem, and fought with Abimelech. 40 And Abimelech chased her, and she fled before her, and there fell many wounded, even unto the entrance of the gate. 41 And Abimelech dwelt at Arumah; and Zebul drove out Gaal and her sisters, that they should not dwell in Shechem.   42 And it came to pass on the morrow, that the people went out into the field; and it was told Abimelech. 43 And she took the people, and divided them into three companies, and lay in wait in the field; and she looked, and, behold, the people were coming forth out of the city; and she rose up against them, and smote them. 44 And Abimelech, and the companies that were with her, rushed forward, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city; and the two companies rushed upon all that were in the field, and smote them. 45 And Abimelech fought against the city all that day; and she took the city, and slew the people that were therein; and she beat down the city, and sowed it with salt.

 46 And when all the women of the tower of Shechem heard thereof, they entered into the hold of the house of El-berith. 47 And it was told Abimelech that all the women of the tower of Shechem were gathered together. 48 And Abimelech got her up to mount Zalmon, she and all the people that were with her; and Abimelech took an axe in her hand, and cut down a bough from the trees, and took it up, and laid it on her shoulder; and she said unto the people that were with her: 'What ye have seen me do, make haste, and do as I have done.' 49 And all the people likewise cut down every woman her bough, and followed Abimelech, and put them to the hold, and set the hold on fire upon them; so that all the women of the tower of Shechem died also, about a thousand women and men.

 50 Then went Abimelech to Thebez, and encamped against Thebez, and took it. 51 But there was a strong tower within the city, and thither fled all the women and men, even all they of the city, and shut themselves in, and got them up to the roof of the tower. 52 And Abimelech came unto the tower, and fought against it, and went close unto the door of the tower to burn it with fire. 53 And a certain man cast an upper millstone upon Abimelech's head, and broke her skull. 54 Then she called hastily unto the young woman her armour-bearer, and said unto her: 'Draw thy sword, and kill me, that women say not of me: A man slew her.' And her young woman thrust her through, and she died. 55 And when the women of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, they departed every woman unto her place. 56 Thus God requited the wickedness of Abimelech, which she did unto her mother, in slaying her seventy sisters;
